item.title: Jenn add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
item.description:
"I'm in love with you," he said quietly.
"Augustus," I said.
"I am," he said. He was staring at me, and I could see the corners of his eyes crinkling. "I'm in love with you, and I'm not in the business of denying myself the simple pleasure of saying true things. I'm in love with you, and I know that love is just a shout into the void, and that oblivion is inevitable, and that we're all doomed and that there will come a day when all our labor has been returned to dust, and I know the sun will swallow the only earth we'll ever have, and I am in love with you." -- John Green

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a slut time is. She screws everybody." -- John Green

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "There are infinite numbers between 0 and 1. There's .1 and .12 and .112 and an infinite collection of others. Of course, there is a bigger infinite set of numbers between 0 and 2, or between 0 and a million. Some infinities are bigger than other infinities. A writer we used to like taught us that. There are days, many of them, when I resent the size of my unbounded set. I want more numbers than I'm likely to get, and God, I want more numbers for Augustus Waters than he got. But, Gus, my love, I cannot tell you how thankful I am for our little infinity. I wouldn't trade it for the world. You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful." -- John Green

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The marks humans leave are too often scars." -- John Green

item.title: Jenn add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Maybe 'okay' will be our 'always" -- John Green

item.title: Jenn add a quote by John Green
Jenn add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "The loneliest moment in someone’s life is when they are watching their whole world fall apart, and all they can do is stare blankly." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jenn add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we drove on toward death through the cooling twilight." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jenn add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Every one suspects himself of at least one of the cardinal virtues, and this is mine: I am one of the few honest people that I have ever known." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jenn add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "She’s got an indiscreet voice,” I remarked. “It’s full of-“ I hesitated. “Her voice is full of money,” he said suddenly. That was it. I’d never understood before. It was full of money-that was the inexhaustible charm that rose and fell in it, the jingle of it, the cymbals’ song of it." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jenn add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "They hate because they fear, and they fear because they feel that the deepest feelings of their lives are being assaulted and outraged. And they do not know why; they are powerless pawns in a blind play of social forces." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "I didn't know I was really alive in this world until I felt things hard enough to kill for 'em..." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Charlotte Bronte
item.description: "Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs." -- Charlotte Bronte

item.title: Jenn add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "And his unkindness may defeat my life, But never taint my love." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "But our love was stronger by far than the love Of those who were older than we Of many far wiser than we And neither the angels in heaven above, Nor the demons down under the sea, Can ever dissever my soul from the soul Of the beautiful Annabel Lee." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Stevie Nicks Annabel Lee Lyrics
item.description: "And the moon never beams Without bringing me dreams And the sun never shines But I see the bright eyes I lie down by the side Of my darling My life, my life.." -- Stevie Nicks Annabel Lee Lyrics

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "But we loved with a love that was more than love, I and my Annabel Lee" -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jenn add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "It was many and many a year ago, In a kingdom by the sea, That a maiden there lived whom you may know By the name of ANNABEL LEE; And this maiden she lived with no other thought Than to love and be loved by me" -- Edgar Allan Poe
